# Effect size

## Gathering information:

Participants:
1) Schizophrenia n = 28
n = 14 with positive symptoms
n = 14 with negative symptoms

2)  Control n = 14

Contrast sensitivity (p6, experiment 1)
1) Significant main effects of Group
F(2,37) = 30.90 , p \< 0.0005

2)  Significant main effects of temporal frequency
F(2,70) = 22.57 , p \< 0.0005

3)  Significant main effects of SF (spatial frequency)
F(3,79) = 38.72 , p \< 0.0005

4)  Group x temporal frequency interaction (not significant)
F(4,77) = 0.77 , p \> 0.05

5)  Significant Group x SF interaction
F(5,79) = 2.30 , p \> 0.05 (the article reports this as significant, I think they made a mistake here)

6)  Significant SF x temporal frequency interaction
F(6,191) = 5.42 , p \< 0.0005

7)  Significant Groups x temporal frequency x SF interaction
F(11,191) = 1.96 , p \< 0.04

### SF = 0.5
Pool positive and negative scz groups
```{r}
# Calculate sd per group
# Approximate SD = (upper limit - lower limit) / 2
sd_sf0.5_ctrl = (4.8898756509106 - 4.694493924834401) / 2
sd_sf0.5_pscz = (4.783303726407286 - 4.570159877400657) / 2
sd_sf0.5_nscz = (4.099467075331143 - 3.8330372640728574) / 2

# Pooling means and sd of positive scz and negative scz

scz_pooled <- pool.groups(n1 = 14,   # sample size group 1
            n2 = 14,   # sample size group 2
            m1 = 4.6856126600993715,  # mean group 1
            m2 = 3.9307283303807714,    # mean group 2
            sd1 = sd_sf0.5_pscz,   # sd group 1
            sd2 = sd_sf0.5_nscz) # sd group2 
scz_pooled

```

Calculate the es of control vs pooled scz
```{r}
# calculate es
slaghuis_2004_es <- esc_mean_sd(grp1m = 4.783303726407286 , grp2m = scz_pooled$Mpooled,  # group mean
            grp1sd = sd_sf0.5_ctrl, grp2sd = scz_pooled$SDpooled, # group sd
            grp1n = 14, grp2n = scz_pooled$Npooled , 
            es.type = "g")
slaghuis_2004_es 
```
